message:
We don't talk about this game nearly enough. Catwoman's just been revealed as a playable character! 

http://www.joystiq.com/2011/06/01/playable-catwoman-unmasked-in-batman-arkham-city
One of those games where I'm trying to avoid seeing or reading anything until after I've played it myself.
I also see talk of Robin being in the game.

And a non-dorky Robin, at that!

http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2011-07-06-rocksteady-outlines-vision-for-robin
http://images.eurogamer.net/assets/articles//a/1/3/7/6/9/0/2/354_robin_219_800_500_80.jpg.jpg

Playable costumes in Arkham City:

http://files.g4tv.com/ImageDb3/279421_S/new-batman-arkham-city-bonus-costumes-revealed-earth-one-the-animated-series-batman-beyond-and-more.jpg
Far left and second from right are awesome.
Second from the left is just asking for Fatman jokes.
That's probably my favourite one. Dark Knight Returns Batman is so inhuman, and probably the meanest of them all. (The Beyond costume does NOT work with that much muscle.)

For the record, these costumes are all dealer exclusives.  (Unless they decide to release them as DLC at a later point.)

Just another thing to hate about the modern games industry.

Gngngahhghghghahghag.

Seriously, what is the point of dealer exclusives? Why was that concept even invented in the first place?

I sort of feel that this is a totally appropriate use of the retailer exclusive. While the entire practice is basically detestable, I'd rather it be wardrobe changes than the missions and levels other games seem to think it's okay to restrict.
Remember when we used to *unlock* costumes by, you know, *playing the game*?

Don't be ridiculous, you can't monetise *unlocking stuff* by *simply playing the game.* Rather offer stuff that people don't want/won't use under the pretence that they're getting value for money from an outlet they don't like shopping at.
Remember when console games never required updates?
Remember when they had 8 colors and came on a cartridge?
I sure miss when my games were buggy for life.
I sure miss the days when developers took the time to test things properly and didn't just say "Eh, we'll patch it later"
What, you don't like Ouroborean (is that a word?) conversations?
Oh boy. Not even going to get into this one.
Remember when threads used to stay on topic? Oh, wait ... never mind.
Remember Creoles?
Creoles! That used to be awesome. Last time I ate that I was in Graaf Reinett - '92 (long time ago). Batman would've loved those (in hope to get thread back on track)
Let's go back to talking about how idiotic Buffel was being, I was just getting started.
I imagine Creoles being more of a Penguin thing though...
http://twitter.com/#!/nolan_north/status/99686236494639105
Nolan North likes Creoles?

Creoles sound like a kind of breakfast cereal.

What kind of cereal do you think Nolan North had before he recorded lines for the Penguin?
Retailer-specific bonuses need to die already.
I note that a retailer-specific bonus for Batman AC has *4 hours* of additional gameplay.  That seems like a significant whack of the game to restrict based on where you've bought it.
@Mr_V I saw that, but it seems to be a challenge map (i.e. beat up guys). I think "4 hours" is being wildly optimistic.
Ah, that does sound slightly less egregious.
